cs351.utility

Class ParallelJobGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs351.utility.ParallelJobGroup

  • public final class ParallelJobGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Note :: This is only to be used by the job system - see the JobList class which should be used to manage individual lists before submitting them to the job system. A job group represents a collection of jobs associated with an atomic integer that points to the current job in the list that needs to be executed. This way a group of threads can work on the same job list.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ParallelJobGroup.JobWrapper
      Maps a Job object to an internal AtomicInteger representing the number of jobs left to execute from a (potentially) larger list of jobs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParallelJobGroup

        public ParallelJobGroup(int priority)
        Creates a ParallelJobGroup of the specified priority. Only jobs of the same priority should be added to the group afterwards.
        Parameters:
        priority - priority of the group (lower is higher priority)

    • Method Detail

      • getPriority

        public int getPriority()
        Gets the priority of the group.
        Returns:
        job group priority

      • getNextJob

        public ParallelJobGroup.JobWrapper getNextJob()
        This will check to see if there is another job in the list and return it if there is. If no jobs are left, null is returned. If you are trying to get the next job from this group, it is best to just call this function and then check to see if the result is null. Calling hasJobs() will return a value that is consistent at that instant, but from the time it returns and the time you call getNextJob() some other thread could have come in and taken the last job.
        Returns:
        a valid job if there is one and null if not

      • addJobs

        public java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger addJobs(java.util.Collection<Job> jobs)
        Adds a list of jobs to the group.
        Parameters:
        jobs - list of valid jobs
        Returns:
        a counter that represents the current state of the list - 0 means all jobs completed

      • hasJobs

        public boolean hasJobs()
        Returns true if there are jobs left in the list.
        Returns:
        true if jobs are left and false if not
